choices.text: Hysteroscope
Intra-uterine insemination cannula
Leech Wilkinson cannula
Uterine manipulator

questions.text: Identify the instrument shown below?
questions.solution:
Ans: C. Leech Wilkinson cannula

  • The image is of a Leech Wilkinson cannula
  • It is used to check tubal patency in infertile women during
    • Hysterosalpingography
    • Laparoscopic tubal recanalization
    • Sonosalpingography
  • In place of Leech Wilkinson cannula, a Rubin’s cannula or a pediatric foley’s catheter can also be used.

Let's Discuss the other options

A. Hysteroscope: This is used to visualize the inside of the uterus and to perfome hysteroscopic procedures

B. IUI Cannula: This is a thin plastic cannula which is used in intra-uterine insemination

C. UTerine manipulator: This is an instrument used in laparoscopic gyn surgeries where ther ethe uterus is manipulated from below using this instrument

 

Educational Objective:

 

  • The image is of a Leech Wilkinson cannula
  • It is used to check tubal patency in infertile women during
    • Hysterosalpingography
    • Laparoscopic tubal recanalization
    • Sonosalpingography

Ref: Page no 216, Shaw’s Textbook of Gynecology, 17th edition

choices.text: Ovarian cystectomy
Myomectomy
Tubal recanalization
Vaginal hysterectomy

questions.text: The instrument shown below is useful in which surgery?
questions.solution:
Ans: B. Myomectomy

  • The image is of a myoma screw.
  • It is an instrument used in myomectomy.
  • Myomectomy is a conservative surgery for fibroid uterus
    • It can be performed via laparotomy or laparoscopically
    • Risk of bleeding can be reduced
      • Preoperatively
        • GnRH agonists: They also reduce the size of the fibroid
        • Correction of anemia/ blood transfusion
        • Uterine Artery Embolization
      • Intra-operatively
        • Use of Bonney’s uterine clamp/ uterine tourniquet (tied at the level of the uterine arteries)
        • Use of vasopressin: injected along the planned serosal incision

Educational Objective:

 

  • The image is of a myoma screw.
  • It is an instrument used in myomectomy.

 

Ref: Page no 946, William’s Gynecology 3rd edition

choices.text: Total laparoscopic hysterectomy
Tubal recanalization
Myomectomy
Wertheim’s Hysterectomy

questions.text: You notice the below shown instrument being used in the Gyn OT. Which surgery would this instrument be used in?
questions.solution:
Ans: A. Total laparoscopic hysterectomy

  • The image shows a Uterine manipulator (Mangeshikar type)
  • It is used to assist movements of the uterus in laparoscopic surgeries, particularly in laparoscopic hysterectomies.
  • They are beneficial in improving visualization and providing a landmark for the colpotomy during hysterectomy.
  • They also help in other laparoscopic surgeries as they can manipulate the uterus and assist the surgeon during different laparoscopic pelvic surgeries.

Other options:

  • Tubal recanalization: For this the babcocks forceps is important to remember as the tube is a delicate structure and to hold it without trauma, a babcocks forceps is prefered
  • Myomectomy: For this surgery, remember 2 instruments: The myoma screw and Bonney's myomectomy clamp
  • Wettheims Hysterectomy: This is a type 2 radical hysterectomy and instruments used in a routine abdominal hysterectomy are used here also

Educational Objective:

  • The image shows a Uterine manipulator (Mangeshikar type)
  • It is used to assist movements of the uterus in laparoscopic surgeries, particularly in laparoscopic hysterectomies.
  • They are beneficial in improving visualization and providing a landmark for the colpotomy during hysterectomy.
  • They also help in other laparoscopic surgeries as they can manipulate the uterus and assist the surgeon during different laparoscopic pelvic surgeries.

choices.text: Bonnie’s clamp during surgery
Bilateral Uterine artery ligation
Ligation of vessels over the surface of the myoma
Use of vasopressin along the planned serosal incision

questions.text: A 36-year lady presents with menorrhagia. On evaluation she is found to have a large intramural fibroid. A myomectomy is planned. All are beneficial in reducing blood loss during surgery except?
questions.solution:
Ans: C. Ligation of vessels over the surface of the myoma

Let's Discuss all the options

  • Option A: Bonnie’s clamp during surgery: This helps by occluding the uterine arteries thereby cutting off supply to the myoma temporarily
  • Option B: Bilateral Uterine artery ligation: This helps by occluding the uterine arteries. Eventually, through reanastomoses, vascularity returns 
  • Option C: Ligation of vessels over the surface of the myoma: This will not help. The fibroid receieves blood circumferentially and is very vascular. 
  • Option D: Use of vasopressin along the planned serosal incision. Diluted vasopressin (1 amp i.e. 20U/ml diluted in 200ml NS). This helps reduce bleeding by causing vasoconstriction of the vessels surrounding the fibroid and is routinely done in myomectomy surgeries

 

Educational Objective: 

  • Myomectomy is a conservative surgery for fibroid uterus
    • It can be performed via laparotomy or laparoscopically
    • Risk of bleeding. This can be reduced
      • Preoperatively
        1. GnRH agonists: They also reduce the size of the fibroid
        2. Correction of anemia/ blood transfusion
        3. Uterine Artery Embolization
      • Intra-operatively
        1. Use of Bonney’s uterine clamp/ uterine tourniquet (tied at the level of the uterine arteries)
        2. Use of vasopressin: injected along the planned serosal incision

Ref: Page no 946, William’s Gynecology 3rd edition

choices.text: Bonney’s myomectomy clamp
Green Armitage
Shirodkar’s clamp
Uterine manipulator

questions.text: Identify this instrument:
questions.solution:
Ans: A. Bonney’s myomectomy clamp

  • This is a Bonney’s myomectomy clamp
  • It is applied at the level of the uterine arteries during abdominal myomectomy to reduce the intraoperative blood loss

Let's Discuss the other options

Option B: A Green Armitage forceps is used to hold the angles of the uterine incision during a cesarean

Option C: Shirodkar’s clamp: Used to hold the uterus during various uterine procedures

Option D: Uterine manipulator: Used in laparoscopic surgeries like total laparoscopic hysterectomy; helps in uterine manipulation and placement of colpotomy.

Educational Objective:

  • This is a Bonney’s myomectomy clamp
  • It is applied at the level of the uterine arteries during abdominal myomectomy to reduce the intraoperative blood loss

Ref: Page no 527, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology 7th edition

choices.text: Ovum forceps
Punch biopsy forceps
Tenaculum
Uterine curette

questions.text: A 44 year old woman undergoes dilation and curettage for abnormal uterine bleeding. Identify this instrument used in the procedure.
questions.solution:
Ans: D. Uterine curette

  • This is an image of a uterine curette
  • It is used for curetting the endometrium in the following procedures
    • Dilatation and curettage
    • Following suction evacuation in MTP
  • It has a sharp end (used in gyn procedures) and a blunt end (used in obstetric procedures)

Lets Discuss the other options:

Option A: Ovum forceps: This is a forceps used to evacuate products of conception during a dilatation and evacuation in incomplete abortion/ retained products of conception

Option B: Punch biopsy forceps: This is a forceps used in taking a cervical biopsy from a cervical growth

Option C: Tenaculum: This is sharp toothed instrument used to hold the cervix in patients who are not pregnant

Educational Objective:

 

  • This is an image of a uterine curette
  • It is used for curetting the endometrium in the following procedures
    • Dilatation and curettage
    • Following suction evacuation in MTP
  • It has a sharp end (used in gyn procedures) and a blunt end (used in obstetric procedures)

Ref: Page no 523, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 7th edition

choices.text: a,b,c,e,f,g
a,b,c,g,f
a,c,f,g
a,c,f,g,h

questions.text:
A 48y woman undergoes a diagnostic dilatation and curettage for abnormal uterine bleeding. Which of the following instruments listed below are used in her dilatation and curettage?

 

  1. Uterine curette
  2. Ovum forceps
  3. Sim’s speculum
  4. Punch biopsy forceps
  5. Artery forceps
  6. Vulsellum
  7. Hegar dilators
  8. Babcock forceps
questions.solution:
Ans: C. a,c,f,g

A dilatation and curettage (D & C) is indicated in diagnosing endometrial pathology in abnormal uterine bleeding.

The following instruments are used:

  1. Sponge holding forceps/ ring forceps to paint the prepared area
  2. Sim’s speculum and anterior vaginal wall retractor to visualize the cervix
  3. Vulsellum or tenaculum to hold the anterior cervical lip
  4. Uterine sound to measure the uterine length
  5. Hegar dilators to dilate the cervix
  6. Uterine curette to curette the endometrium

Other options:

  • An ovum forceps is used in an incomplete abortion/ 1st trimester MTP to remove the products of conception if suction is not available
  • A punch biopsy forceps is used to take a biopsy of a cervical growth
  • An artery forceps and a Babcock forceps are usually used in abdominal surgeries

Educational Objective: 

A dilatation and curettage (D & C) is indicated in diagnosing endometrial pathology in abnormal uterine bleeding.

The following instruments are used:

  1. Sponge holding forceps/ ring forceps to paint the prepared area
  2. Sim’s speculum and anterior vaginal wall retractor to visualize the cervix
  3. Vulsellum or tenaculum to hold the anterior cervical lip
  4. Uterine sound to measure the uterine length
  5. Hegar dilators to dilate the cervix
  6. Uterine curette to curette the endometrium

Ref: Page no 486, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 7th edition

choices.text: Allis forceps
Bard Parker handle with scalpel
FNAC needle
Punch biopsy forceps

questions.text: A 66y lady presents with postmenopausal bleeding. On speculum examination, a growth is seen on the cervix as shown. Which instrument should be used to take a biopsy of the growth?
questions.solution:
Ans: D. Punch biopsy forceps

  • This is an image of a cervical growth probably carcinoma cervix
  • To confirm the diagnosis, a biopsy is taken using a punch biopsy forceps from the margins of the growth (to avoid central areas as these can be necrotic)
  • A punch biopsy forceps is a long metallic instrument
  • At one end there are sharp cutting edges to punch out biopsy from cervical growth

Other options: 

  • Option A: Allis forceps: This can be used but is not the appropriate instrument/ instrument of choice. Allis forceps is a toothed forceps used to hold tough structures like the rectus sheath
  • Option B: BP knife: This is used when taking an excision biopsy. 
  • Option C: FNAC needle: This is a needle used to aspirate fluid/ tissue for cytology and is not used in cervical growths

Educational Objective:

 

  • Whenever there is a cervical grwthm to confirm the diagnosis, a biopsy is taken using a punch biopsy forceps from the margins of the growth (to avoid central areas as these can be necrotic)
  • A punch biopsy forceps is a long metallic instrument
  • At one end there are sharp cutting edges to punch out biopsy from cervical growth

Ref: Page no 531, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 7th edition

choices.text: a,b,c,e
a,b,e
a,e
a,b,d,e

questions.text:
An intern is posted in the gyn OPD. He is asked to take a pap smear of a 32 y old woman. Which instruments would he require for this procedure?

 

  1. Cusco speculum
  2. Anterior vaginal wall retractor
  3. Vulsellum
  4. Artery forceps
  5. Ayre’s spatula
questions.solution:
Ans: C. a,e

  • A pap smear is a procedure performed to screen for cervical cancer
  • As per ACOG/ ACS guidelines (2021); indications for screening include

 

 

  • A pap smear is taken using the following instruments
    • A speculum (Cusco or Sims): If using Sims, an anterior vaginal wall retractor is used along with it.
    • An Ayres spatula (sampling the ectocervix) and a cytobrush (sampling the endocervix)
  • After visualizing the cervix, the long end of the Ayre’s spatula is inserted into the os and rotated 3600 to obtain a sample from the ectocervix.
  • The cytobrush is used to take an endocervical sample.
  • The spatula and brush are then smeared onto a slide and placed in a jar with fixative or sprayed with fixative
  • The fixative contains 95% ethyl alcohol.

Educational Objective:

 

Ref: Page no 265, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 7th edition

choices.text: a,d
a,b,f
a,b,c,d

questions.text:
A 32y lady presents to the OPD. She has a Copper T inserted 5 years earlier. She now wants to conceive and has come for removal of the copper T. Which instruments are required for this procedure?

 

  1. Cuscos speculum
  2. Vulsellum
  3. Uterine sound
  4. Artery forceps
  5. Anterior vaginal wall retractor
  6. Allis forceps
questions.solution:
Ans: A. a,d

IUCD removal is done for the following indications

    • Personal reasons (offers no reason at all) The woman has a right to discontinue the method at any time, regardless of the reason.
    • Wants another child
    • IUCD to be replaced (i.e., at the end of its effective life)
    • Pregnancy
    • Heavy menstrual bleeding
    • Menopause
    • Evidence of IUCD displacement

IUCD removal is done by the following procedure:

  • Insert a sterile speculum and visualize the cervix and the IUCD strings.
  • Cleanse the cervix and vagina with an appropriate antiseptic
  • Grasp the strings of the IUCD with a sterile straight artery forceps
  • Apply steady but gentle traction, gently pulling the strings toward you with the forceps and remove the IUCD

Educational Objective:

Instruments used in IUCD removal are

  • Cusco's speculum
  • Long artery forceps

Ref: Page no 260, Shaw’s Textbook of Gynecology, 17th edition

  • The size of the dilator is decided by its diameter (ranges between 3mm to 12mm)
  • They are available in graduated sets with increasing diameters of 0.5 mm or 1 mm
  • Indications of use

choices.text: All the vaginal walls can be easily visualized
Its use does not require assistance
Several cervical and uterine procedures can be carried out
The groove allows drainage of secretions/ blood

questions.text: All are advantages of the below given instrument except?
questions.solution:
Ans: B. Its use does not require assistance

The image shows a Sims speculum

Let's Discuss all the Options:

  • Option A: All the vaginal walls can be easily visualized: This is correct as with the Sims speculum, the vaginal walls are not obscured
  • Option B. Its use does not require assistance: This is incorrect. With a Sims Speculum, an anterior vaginal wall retractor is always used and this would leave the operator with no free hands. Hence assistance is always required
  • Option C: Several cervical and uterine procedures can be carried out: This is correct. As there is a lot of space with this isntrument, several procedures are carried out vaginally
  • Option D: The groove allows drainage of secretions/ blood. This is also correct. Through this groove, vaginal discharge, blood, amniotic fluid drains out

Educational Objective:

Sims Speculum

 

    • Double bladed speculum
    • Used to visualize the vaginal walls and cervix
    • Used in several procedures including IUCD insertion, D & C and vaginal hysterectomies
  • Advantages
    • More space (compared to a Cuscos speculum)
    • Better visualization of the vaginal walls
    • The groove provides drainage of blood/ liquor/ secretions
  • Disadvantages
    • Not self retaining and hence requires assistance; used along with the anterior vaginal wall retractor

Cuscos Speculum

 

 

  • Bivalved, self-retaining speculum
  • Used to visualize the cervix and in limited procedures (due to limited space) like taking a pap smear, IUCD insertion and removal.
  • Advantages
  • Self retaining so no assistance required
  • Disadvantages
    • Limited space so limited procedures can be done
    • Ant and post vaginal walls not visualized
    • The lock may get spoiled if not taken care of

 

Ref: Page no 518, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 17th edition

questions.text: In which surgery would the instrument shown below be used?
questions.solution:
Ans: D. Tubal ligation

  • This is an image of a Babcock forceps
  • It is used to hold delicate organs as they are less traumatic
    • In gynecological surgeries, they are used to hold the fallopian tube in tubal ligation and tubal recanalization
    • Also used to hold the appendix, bladder margins, ureter etc
    • To hold the lymph nodes during lymph node dissection

Educational Objective:

 

  • This is an image of a Babcock forceps
  • It is used to hold delicate organs as they are less traumatic
    • In gynecological surgeries, they are used to hold the fallopian tube in tubal ligation and tubal recanalization
    • Also used to hold the appendix, bladder margins, ureter etc
    • To hold the lymph nodes during lymph node dissection

Ref: Page no 530, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 17th edition

choices.text: A drop of saline on the hub of the needle is sucked in if the needle is in the peritoneal cavity
On pushing saline, the fluid can’t be aspirated if it is in the peritoneal cavity
The pressure in the peritoneal cavity will be > 10 mmHg, if the needle is in the peritoneal cavity.
Obliteration of liver dullness if gas is intraperitoneal

questions.text: A 35-year woman was planned to undergo a laparoscopic tubal ligation. The instrument shown below was used to create pneumoperitoneum. All are signs that carbon dioxide is in the peritoneal cavity except?
questions.solution:
Ans: C. The pressure in the peritoneal cavity will be > 10 mmHg, if the needle is in the peritoneal cavity.

The image shown is a Verres needle

Let's discuss all options

  • Option A: A drop of saline on the hub of the needle is sucked in if the needle is in the peritoneal cavity: This is correct as due to the negative pressure, the fluid gets sucked in. 
  • Option B:  On pushing saline, the fluid can’t be aspirated if it is in the peritoneal cavity: This is also correct as if the placement of the verres is correct, you wont be able to aspirate the fluid from the peritoneal cavity as its a huge cavity.
  • Option C: The pressure in the peritoneal cavity will be > 10 mmHg, if the needle is in the peritoneal cavity. This is incorrect. The intra peritoneal pressure is < 10mmHg
  • Option D: Obliteration of liver dullness if gas is intraperitoneal,  This is correct. Once pneumoperitoneum is created, then then liver dullness (on percussion) will be obliterated

Educational Objective:

  • An important part of laparoscopic surgeries is creation of pneumoperitoneum
  • The image shows a Verres needle which is used to create a pneumoperitoneum.
  • It is typically inserted at the level of the umbilicus as there is no fat of muscle at this site.
  • Palmer’s point is preferred if adhesions are anticipated. This point is 3 cm below the left costal margin in the mid-clavicular line.
  • Intraperitoneal placement of the needle is confirmed by
    • Drop test: place a drop of saline on the hub of the needle and life the abdominal wall; the drop is sucked in
    • The insufflator will show a reading of intraperitoneal pressure < 10 mmHg (single digit reading)
    • Push 5 ml of saline in the peritoneal cavity and then attempt to aspirate it. No fluid can be aspirated if the needle is in the peritoneal cavity.
    • Liver dullness is obliterated if CO2 is flowing intra-peritoneally.

Ref: Page no 273, Te Linde’s Operative Gynecology 11th edition

Laparoscopic ring applicator

questions.text: Identify this instrument:
questions.solution:
Ans: B. Laparoscopic ring applicator

  • This instrument is a laparoscopic ring applicator also called a laparocator.
  • Laparosocopic sterilizations can be done through this single instrument by a single 10 mm incision.
  • It has prongs to pick up a loop of fallopian tube and an applicator for pushing the falope rings over the loop.

Educational Obejctive:

This is a laparoscopic ring applicator used in laparoscopic tubal ligations

Ref: Page no 410, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 7th edition

choices.text: Intra-abdominal pressure, rate of gas flow and volume of gas used
Intra-abdominal pressure, rate of gas flow and light intensity
Rate of gas flow, volume of gas used and light intensity

questions.text: A 45-year woman is undergoing a total laparoscopic hysterectomy for fibroid uterus. You notice the following equipment in the operation theater. What do the 3 markings show?
questions.solution:
Ans: A. Intra-abdominal pressure, rate of gas flow and volume of gas used

  • This is an image of an electronic gas insufflator
  • The insufflator regulates the rate of inflow of gas to create/ maintain the intra-abdominal pressure.
  • It shows 3 readings
  1. Intra-abdominal pressure
  2. Rate of gas flow
  3. Volume of gas used
  • There is a gas cable which connects the insufflator to the Verres needle/ port for inflow of gas.

Educational Objective:

 

  • This is an image of an electronic gas insufflator
  • The insufflator regulates the rate of inflow of gas to create/ maintain the intra-abdominal pressure.
  • It shows 3 readings
  1. Intra-abdominal pressure
  2. Rate of gas flow
  3. Volume of gas used

 

 

Ref: Page no 759, Novak’s Gynecology 15th edition

choices.text: Allis forceps
Long artery forceps
Ring forceps
Vulsellum

questions.text: A 42 year woman is undergoing an endometrial biopsy for abnormal uterine bleeding. You are assisting the resident for the procedure, and you are asked to hold the anterior lip of the cervix with the instrument shown below. What is the name of this instrument?
questions.solution:
Ans: D. Vulsellum

This is a Vulsellum

  • It is a 28 cm long instrument with blades gently curved on 1 side
  • The tips of the blade have 2-3 teeth ensuring a grip on the structure held
  • Used to hold the anterior lip of the non-pregnant cervix prior to any procedure on the cervix/ uterus
    • To sound the uterus and measure utero-cervical length
    • To carry out procedures on the cervix like cervical biopsy, cervical dilatation, endocervical curettage
    • To carry put procedure son the cervix like endometrial aspiration, polypectomy, IUCD insertion, MTP, HSG etc.
    • To give traction to the cervix during vaginal hysterectomy
  • Used to hold the posterior lip of the cervix during
    • Culdocentesis (aspiration from pouch of Douglas; sometimes done in suspected ruptured ectopic)
    • Examination for enterocele and rectocele

Let's Discuss all the Options:

  • Option A: Allis forceps: This is a toothed instrument used to hold tough structures like the rectus sheath and uterine margin at cesareans section

  • Option B: Long artery froceps:

  • Option C: Ring Forceps: Also called as spinge holding forceps

Educational Objective:

  • This is a vulsullum forceps
  • Used to hold the anterior lip of the non-pregnant cervix prior to any procedure on the cervix/ uterus
    • To sound the uterus and measure utero-cervical length
    • To carry out procedures on the cervix like cervical biopsy, cervical dilatation, endocervical curettage
    • To carry put procedure son the cervix like endometrial aspiration, polypectomy, IUCD insertion, MTP, HSG etc.
    • To give traction to the cervix during vaginal hysterectomy
  • Used to hold the posterior lip of the cervix during
    • Culdocentesis (aspiration from pouch of Douglas; sometimes done in suspected ruptured ectopic)
    • Examination for enterocele and rectocele

Ref: Page no 521, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 7th edition

choices.text: Artery forceps
Sims Speculum
Uterine sound
Vulsellum

questions.text: The following instruments are required for an IUCD insertion except?
questions.solution:
Ans: A. Artery forceps

An artery forceps is used t remove an IUCD and is not used in IUCD insertion

Educational Objective: 

Steps of IUCD insertion:

  • The posterior vaginal wall is retracted with Sim’s speculum and the anterior lip of cervix is held with the Vulsellum
  • The cervix is cleaned with a betadine swab (on a sponge holding forceps)
  • Uterine sound is introduced and the uterocervical length is measured.
  • The horizontal limbs of the CuT are inserted into the inserter using a no-touch technique
  • The tip of the plunger is placed in contact with the end of the vertical limb of the CuT
  • The whole assembly is placed in the uterine cavity till the guard is in contact with the external os
  • The plunger is stabilized, and the inserter is withdrawn to release the CuT and then both plunger and inserter are withdrawn together
  • The threads are trimmed to about 1 inch from the external os with a suture cutting scissors.

 

Ref:https://nhm.gov.in/images/pdf/guidelines/nrhm-guidelines/family-planning/medical_officer.pdf

choices.text: Trans-vaginal tape
Burch colposuspension
Anterior colporrhaphy
Trans-obturator tape

questions.text: Identify instrument used in this procedure?
questions.solution:
Ans: D. Trans-obturator tape

  • The image shows Trans-Obturator Tape (TOT). This is a surgical repair for Stress urinary incontinence (SUI)

Let's Discuss the other options: 

  • Option A: Transvaginal tape: This is a procedure also use in SUI. In this the tape comes out supra pubically and not through the obturator foramen
  • Option B: Burch colposuspension: This is the gold standard surgical procedure fr a SUI and can be done via laparotomy and laparoscopy
  • Option C: Anterior colporrhaphy: This is a surgery to correct a cystocele

Educational Objective:

Surgical repair for Stress Urinary Incontinence

  • Kelly’s repair (vaginal plication of bladder neck)
  • Retropubic colposuspension (Marshall Marchetti Krantz operation)
  • Burch colposuspension
    • Gold standard surgery for SUI
  • Tension free transvaginal tape
  • Trans-obturator tape
    • Mid-urethral tape
    • A tape is inserted mid-urethra by passing the trocar from the thigh to the obturator canal
  • Peri-urethral collage injection

Ref: Page no 392, Shaw’s Textbook of Gynecology, 17th edition

choices.text: Long artery forceps
Ovum forceps
Sponge holding forceps
Tenaculum

questions.text: Identify this instrument:
questions.solution:
Ans: B. Ovum forceps

  • Ovum forceps has spoon shaped, blunt ends that come in close contact with each other when closed
  • There is no catch on the handles so that any structure held inadvertently does not get crushed and traumatized but gets released when the instrument is drawn out.
  • Indications
    • Inevitable abortion to remove products of conception
    • Incomplete abortion to remove products of conception
    • Removal of foreign body from uterine cavity
  • Uterine perforation is a complication

Educational Objective:

  • Ovum forceps has spoon shaped, blunt ends that come in close contact with each other when closed
  • There is no catch on the handles so that any structure held inadvertently does not get crushed and traumatized but gets released when the instrument is drawn out.
  • Indications
    • Inevitable abortion to remove products of conception
    • Incomplete abortion to remove products of conception
    • Removal of foreign body from uterine cavity
  • Uterine perforation is a complication

Ref: Page no 525, Shaw’s Textbook of Gynecology, 17th edition

choices.text: Cervical biopsy
Cervical conization
Cervical cerclage
Large loop excision of the transformation zone

questions.text: Identify the procedure being done in the image?
questions.solution:
Ans: D. Large loop excision of the transformation zone

  • The image is of Large Loop excision of the transformation zone (LLETZ) or loop electrosurgical excision procedure
  • This involves the removal of either the cervical lesion or the entire transformation zone using a thin, heated, stainless steel or tungsten wire loop electro-surgically.
  • Indications
    • Moderately severe to severe dysplasia (CIN II and CIN III)
  • Other excisional methods for CIN II and CIN III include
    • Cold knife conization
    • Laser conization
    • Needle excision of transformation zone

Educational Objective:

 

  • The image is of Large Loop excision of the transformation zone (LLETZ) or loop electrosurgical excision procedure
  • This involves the removal of either the cervical lesion or the entire transformation zone using a thin, heated, stainless steel or tungsten wire loop electro-surgically.
  • Indications
    • Moderately severe to severe dysplasia (CIN II and CIN III)
  • Other excisional methods for CIN II and CIN III include
    • Cold knife conization
    • Laser conization
    • Needle excision of transformation zone

Ref: Page no 418, Shaw’s Textbook of Gynecology, 17th edition
